comment.author: 11334970@N05
comment._content: Hi, Thanks for your comment. There have been several ships bearing the name ‘Discovery’ and the vessel docked in Dundee is the RRS ‘Discovery’, a purpose-built, ice-strengthened ship and the first vessel built in Britain to be constructed specifically for scientific research. In August 1901 Captain Robert Falcon Scott set sail, aboard the RRS ‘Discovery’, on his first journey to the Antarctic, to perform magnetic surveys of the area, accompanied by Ernest Shackleton and Edward Wilson. This famous expedition would be known later as the ‘Discovery Expedition’. Unfortunately not much is known of the circumstances surrounding the fate of the HMS ‘Discovery’ (pictured above). She was captained by George Nares during his 1875–6 Arctic expedition. It is believed that she was sold in 1902.
